titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 143
CWG12071

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, April 9th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 143.
(Extract.)

28. At the request of the Governor of Kentucky, the following enlisted men are hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States, to enable them to accept commissions in Kentucky regiments: --
Private Henry P. Merrill, Company "A," 22d Michigan Volunteers.
Private Allen S. Whetstone, Company "A," 104th Ohio Volunteers.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townssend
Assistant Adjutant General.

4: Infy
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington April 9. 1864.
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G --
At the request of the Governor of Kentucky the following enlisted men are hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States to enable them to accept commissions in Ky Regiments.

Priv Henry P. Merrill Coy. A 22nd Mich
" Allen S. Whetstone Coy. A 104 Ohio.
